pulfalight.title: Display Description in component overview.
Series/component-level notes are not displaying

comments.body: I have origination and scopecontent working in #616. I can't do bioghist yet because the EADs that get exported from ASpace don't include the component's bioghist, just the collection's.
@faithc It might be a lot to ask, but if there are other series notes not displaying could you find examples like you did for those three? It helps a lot.

Another example: https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/catalog/C1596; none of the series/component-level notes are displaying, only some of the Collection overview notes. 
Couple specific examples from this collection: 
https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/catalog/C1596_c1 vs. https://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/C1596/c1
https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/catalog/C1596_c78 vs. https://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/C1596/c78

pulfalight.title: For search results, include scope content note (or abstract for collection-level results) along with breadcrumbs

comments.body: I think we were wondering if description (scopecontent) notes could display for components as well.

pulfalight.title: Navigation from Component to Collection-Level view results in Request Cart being displayed at the wrong level.

comments.body: There seems to be this expectation that the "collection" tabs pop you back up to the collection. I was under the impression these were just shortcuts for constant information about the collection, and the context of the page (and the only way to navigate away) is always what's reflected in the table of contents, so the buttons at the bottom if you're on the collection tab don't reference the collection, but the component.

I don't think this interface works for what you're suggesting, @tpendragon. Since the collection tab content uses the same content pane as the components, and the buttons on the bottom are visually tied to that pane, the "actions" a user can take via the buttons need to be related to the content in that pane.

pulfalight.title: Ask a Question button should display in Collection navigation
Adds Ask A Question button to top level of collection
Add "Names" to homepage

comments.body: Decision at DSSG 01/26/21: we should remove the topics, but still include the name browse. I've updated the title of this issue to reflect adding just the names back to the home page.
This is not going to be done by Friday.
@tpendragon That's fine — I just wanted to make sure we don't add the topics back, since there was a review and decision that they weren't helpful, and I remembered seeing this ticket.

pulfalight.title: Cannot page through viewer (UV) with only the keyboard.

comments.body: My understanding is that we want to do as much as we can to meet the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for PulfaLight. @tpendragon I agree that getting changes to the UV in time (without forking) would be impossible. What about the use of Mirador 3 (at least for non-AV materials), which already meets the accessibility guidelines? Is this a question for @kelynch?
I think it makes sense to try to update the Universal Viewer and stay in line with its accessibility updates, and agree that it's something we should focus on after this week.

pulfalight.title: Sets focus on request cart, when opened
Create Research Account button has wrong link
Fix Create a Research Account button.
Using quotes in keyword search yields no results

comments.body: This is interesting. It's because the records are mostly in the form of "Frederic Vinton" or "Vinton, Frederic" and Solr considers the quotes to be an exact match phrase query. Should we strip the quotes and remove that functionality?
Ah. And yes, I think so since that's how the current site functions. @ccleeton?
Agreed!

pulfalight.title: Search results are not being listed by relevancy

comments.body: I think we're better than we were. Maybe if I boost matches where the item's in a collection with that title?

@faithc Can you look at https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/catalog?group=true&q=board+of+trustees&search_field=all_fields actually and confirm those results aren't acceptable? We did some boosting before which I think has helped a lot.
Perhaps it's better? But the Board of Trustees records collection should be the first result. @ccleeton looping you in too.

Yes, since the words Board of Trustees are in the collection name it should appear first.
This one is doing the same thing Search office of the president and the collection comes second https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/?utf8=%E2%9C%93&group=true&search_field=all_fields&q=office+of+the+president
Not to mention there are many other office of the president collections not showing

I spent a ridiculously long time trying to boost items which had collections that exactly matched the given query and was not successful. Instead, for now, I think I'm going to adjust the "mm" parameter to limit the number of results that get returned and return to this at some other time.

Relevant things I tried:

http://robotlibrarian.billdueber.com/2012/03/using-localparams-in-solr-sst-2/
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20217686/multiple-boost-queries-in-solr/20345687#20345687

pulfalight.title: Increase "mm" value.
Search results are increasing results when using filters not decreasing

comments.body: @ccleeton This should be significantly better now. Can you check `findingaids-beta.princeton.edu` and confirm, closing this if so?

pulfalight.title: Rename tab headers.
Strip quotes from searches.
Search results when a name is selected from the Names facet are confusing/duplicative

comments.body:
@faithc This is also interesting. Things are listed twice because only collections have indexed names, there aren't any components with "Paz, Octavio, 1914-1998". Would you expect search results to show every component in every collection that has that name?

I can propagate the names from collections to components for discovery purposes, if necessary.

pulfalight.title: Keyword search for name in direct order yields too many results

comments.body: I think this happens because we had to set the MM parameter to be really low (minimum must match) to make box/folder queries return. We'll have to do some fiddling to see if we can improve things.

I set minimum must match to 75%, which means 75% of the query has to appear for an item to show up in results. I can make that number higher for more restricted results (100% means every word needs to show up), but I think we should fiddle with that later.
